quote: Civilization is the making of civil persons.
A book worth reading is worth buying.
A great thing can only be done by a great person; and they do it without effort.
A little thought and a little kindness are often worth more than a great deal of money.
A thing is worth what it can do for you, not what you choose to pay for it.

An infinitude of tenderness is the chief gift and inheritance of all truly great men.
An unimaginative person can neither be reverent or kind.
Be sure that you go to the author to get at his meaning, not to find yours.
Better the rudest work that tells a story or records a fact, than the richest without meaning.
Books are divided into two classes, the books of the hour and the books of all time.

Everything costs its own cost, and one of our best virtues is a just desire to pay it.

Give little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.

If a book is worth reading, it is worth buying.
Imaginary evils soon become real one by indulging our reflections on them.
In general, pride is at the bottom of all great mistakes.

It takes a great deal of living to get a little deal of learning.
Labour without joy is base. Labour without sorrow is base. Sorrow without labour is base. Joy without labour is base.
Large fortunes are all founded either on the occupation of land, or lending or the taxation of labor.
Life without industr is guilt, and industry without art is brute lity.
Life without industry is guilt. Industry without Art is Brutality.
Men cannot not live by exchanging articles, but producing them. They live by work not trade.
Mountains are the beginning and the end of all natural scenery.
Music when healthy, is the teacher of perfect order, and when depraved, the teacher of perfect disorder.
No architecture is so haughty as that which is simple.
No good is ever done to society by the pictorial representation of its diseases.
No great intellectual thing was ever done by great effort.
No human being, however great, or powerful, was ever so free as a fish.
Nothing can be beautiful which is not true.

Once thoroughly our own knowledge ceases to give us pleasure.
One who does not know when to die, does not know how to live.
People cannot live by lending money to one another.
Punishment is the last and the least effective instrument in the hands of the legislator for the prevention of crime.

Spiritual power begins by directing animal power to other than egoistic ends.
Tell me what you like and I'll tell you what you are.
The anger of a person who is strong, can always bide its time.
The best thing in life aren't things.
The best work never was and never will be done for money.
The child who desires education will be bettered by it; the child who dislikes it disgraced.

The distinctive character of a child is to always live in the tangible present.

The imagination is never governed, it is always the ruling and divine power.
The last act crowns the play.
The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love color the most.
The saying that beauty is but skin deep is but a skin deep saying.
The secret of language is the secret of sympathy and its full charm is possible only to the gentle.
The sky is the part of creation in which nature has done for the sake of pleasing man.

The strength and power of a country depends absolutely on the quantity of good men and women in it.

There is no action so slight or so mean but it may be done to a great purpose, and ennobled thereby.
